name: occurrence
title: Occurrence
description: The state of a dwc:Organism at some location during some time.

fields.name: occurrenceID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Occurrence.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a persistent, globally unique identifier. In the absence of a persistent global unique identifier, construct one from a combination of identifiers in the record that will most closely make a dwc:occurrenceID globally unique.

fields.name: eventID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: surveyTargetID
fields.description: An identifier for a SurveyTarget.

fields.name: recordedBy
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations responsible for recording a dwc:Occurrence.
fields.examples: `Jos√© E. Crespo`; `Oliver P. Pearson | Anita K. Pearson`, `FMNH`

fields.name: recordedByID
fields.description: An identifier for the Agent responsible for recording a dwc:Occurrence.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: organismQuantity
fields.description: A number or enumeration value for the quantity of dwc:Organisms.
fields.comments: A dwc:organismQuantity must have a corresponding dwc:organismQuantityType.
fields.examples: `27` (organismQuantity) with `individuals` (organismQuantityType); `12.5` (organismQuantity) with `% biomass` (organismQuantityType); `r` (organismQuantity) with `Braun-Blanquet Scale` (organismQuantityType); `many` (organismQuantity) with `individuals` (organismQuantityType)

fields.name: organismQuantityType
fields.description: A type of quantification system used for the quantity of dwc:Organisms.
fields.comments: A dwc:organismQuantityType must have a corresponding dwc:organismQuantity. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.examples: `27` (organismQuantity) with `individuals` (organismQuantityType); `12.5` (organismQuantity) with `% biomass` (organismQuantityType); `r` (organismQuantity) with `Braun-Blanquet Scale` (organismQuantityType); `many` (organismQuantity) with `individuals` (organismQuantityType)

fields.name: organismQuantityTypeIRI
fields.description: The IRI of the controlled vocabulary value for an organism quantity type.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use an IRI for a term in a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: organismQuantityTypeVocabulary
fields.description: The reference to the controlled vocabulary where the definition of the value for dwc:organismQuantityType is given.

fields.name: sex
fields.description: The sex of a dwc:Organism.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: lifeStage
fields.description: The age class or life stage of a dwc:Organism.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: reproductiveCondition
fields.description: The reproductive condition a dwc:Organism.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: caste
fields.description: The social caste of a dwc:Organism.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary that aligns best with a dwc:Taxon. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: behavior
fields.description: The behavior shown by a dwc:Organism.
fields.comments: This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: vitality
fields.description: An indication of whether a dwc:Organism was alive or dead at the time of collection or observation.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. Intended to be used with records having a dwc:basisOfRecord of PreservedSpecimen, MaterialEntity, MaterialSample, or HumanObservation. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: establishmentMeans
fields.description: Statement about whether a dwc:Organism has been introduced to a given place and time through the direct or indirect activity of modern humans.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use controlled value strings from the controlled vocabulary designated for use with this term, listed at http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/doc/em/. For details, refer to https://doi.org/10.3897/biss.3.38084. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: degreeOfEstablishment
fields.description: The degree to which a dwc:Organism survives, reproduces, and expands its range at a given place and time.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use controlled value strings from the controlled vocabulary designated for use with this term, listed at http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/doc/doe/. For details, refer to https://doi.org/10.3897/biss.3.38084. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: pathway
fields.description: The process by which a dwc:Organism came to be in a given place at a given time.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use controlled value strings from the controlled vocabulary designated for use with this term, listed at http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/doc/pw/. For details, refer to https://doi.org/10.3897/biss.3.38084. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: occurrenceStatus
fields.description: A statement about the presence or absence of a dwc:Organism.
fields.comments: For dwc:Occurrences, the default vocabulary is recommended to consist of present and absent, but can be extended by implementers with good justification. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: occurrenceCitation
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, bibliographic reference, global unique identifier, URI) of literature associated with a dwc:Occurrence.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).
fields.examples: `Christopher J. Conroy, Jennifer L. Neuwald. 2008. Phylogeographic study of the California vole, Microtus californicus Journal of Mammalogy, 89(3):755-767.`; `Steven R. Hoofer and Ronald A. Van Den Bussche. 2001. Phylogenetic Relationships of Plecotine Bats and Allies Based on Mitochondrial Ribosomal Sequences. Journal of Mammalogy 82(1):131-137. | Walker, Faith M., Jeffrey T. Foster, Kevin P. Drees, Carol L. Chambers. 2014. Spotted bat (Euderma maculatum) microsatellite discovery using illumina sequencing. Conservation Genetics Resources.`

fields.name: informationWithheld
fields.description: Additional information that exists, but that has not been shared in the given record.
fields.examples: `location information not given for endangered species`; `collector identities withheld | ask about tissue samples`

fields.name: dataGeneralizations
fields.description: Actions taken to make the shared data less specific or complete than in its original form. Suggests that alternative data of higher quality may be available on request.
fields.examples: `coordinates generalized from original GPS coordinates to the nearest half degree grid cell`

fields.name: occurrenceRemarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about a dwc:Occurrence.

fields.name: organismID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Organism.

fields.name: organismScope
fields.description: A description of the type of dwc:Organism instance.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. Can be used to indicate whether a dwc:Organism instance represents a discrete organism or if it represents a particular type of aggregation.

fields.name: organismScopeIRI
fields.description: The IRI of the controlled vocabulary value for an organism scope.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use an IRI for a term in a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: organismScopeVocabulary
fields.description: The reference to the controlled vocabulary where the definition of the value for dwc:organismScope is given.

fields.name: organismName
fields.description: A name or label assigned to a dwc:Organism.

fields.name: organismRemarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about a dwc:Organism.

fields.name: verbatimIdentification
fields.description: A string representing the taxonomic identification as it appeared in the original record.

fields.name: taxonFormula
fields.description: A string representing the pattern to use to construct a dwc:Identification from dwc:Taxon names and identification qualifiers.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as https://arctos.database.museum/info/ctDocumentation.cfm?table=cttaxa_formula.
fields.examples: `A`; `A ?`; `A or B`; `A and B`; `A x B`; `A cf.`; `A aff.`

fields.name: identifiedBy
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who made a taxonomic determination of a dwc:Organism.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).

fields.name: identifiedByID
fields.description: The identifier for the Agent who made a taxonomic determination of a dwc:Organism.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to provide a single identifier that disambiguates the details of the identifying agent. If a list is used, the order of the identifiers on the list should not be assumed to convey any semantics. Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).

fields.name: dateIdentified
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who made a taxonomic determination of a dwc:Organism.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a date that conforms to ISO 8601-1:2019.

fields.name: identificationReferences
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of references (publication, global unique identifier, URI) used in a dwc:Identification.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).
fields.examples: `Aves del Noroeste Patagonico. Christie et al. 2004.`; `Stebbins, R. Field Guide to Western Reptiles and Amphibians. 3rd Edition. 2003. | Irschick, D.J. and Shaffer, H.B. (1997). The polytypic species revisited: Morphological differentiation among tiger salamanders (Ambystoma tigrinum) (Amphibia: Caudata). Herpetologica, 53(1), 30-49.`

fields.name: identificationVerificationStatus
fields.description: A categorical indicator of the extent to which the taxonomic determination has been verified to be correct.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as that used in HISPID and ABCD.

fields.name: identificationVerificationStatusIRI
fields.description: The IRI of the controlled vocabulary value for an identification verification.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use an IRI for a term in a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: identificationVerificationStatusVocabulary
fields.description: The reference to the controlled vocabulary where the definition of the value for dwc:identificationVerificationStatus is given.

fields.name: identificationRemarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about a dwc:Identification.
fields.examples: `Distinguished between Anthus correndera and Anthus hellmayri based on the comparative lengths of the u√±as.`

fields.name: taxonID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Taxon.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: kingdom
fields.description: The full scientific name of the kingdom in which a dwc:scientificName is classified.

fields.name: scientificName
fields.description: The full scientific name, with authorship and date information if known. When forming part of a dwc:Identification, this should be the name in lowest level taxonomic rank that can be determined. This term should not contain identification qualifications, which should instead be supplied in dwc:verbatimIdentification.

fields.name: taxonRank
fields.description: The taxonomic rank of the most specific name in a dwc:scientificName.

fields.name: taxonRemarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about a dwc:Taxon.
fields.examples: `this name is a misspelling in common use`
